title: Thin film - three waves reflect from a soap bubble

content.question: Three different electromagnetic waves of equal amplitude are normally incident upon the wall of a soap bubble. The figure shows a cross-section of a small portion of the bubble, as well as the three waves. The soap bubble wall has an index of refraction <math alttext="n equals four thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> and a thickness of <math alttext="t equals 225 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>225</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>. Waves <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> have wavelengths in the air of <math alttext="400 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, <math alttext="600 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="800 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks the amplitudes <math alttext="A sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="A sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="A sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math> of the reflections from the soap bubble due to waves <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="A sub X, end sub, equals, A sub Y, end sub, which equals, A sub Z, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="A sub X, end sub, is greater than, A sub Z, end sub, which is greater than, A sub Y, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="A sub Y, end sub, is greater than, A sub Z, end sub, which is greater than, A sub X, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="A sub Z, end sub, is greater than, A sub Y, end sub, which is greater than, A sub X, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>
